H0.text: Red, white, and pink are the possible color offspring that could be produced when two pink flowered plants (RW) are crossed, following a cross of a red flowered plant (RR) with a white flowered plant (WW) that yields pink (RW) plants.

H1.text: Red and white are the possible colors of offspring that can result from crossing two pink flowered plants (genotype RW).

H2.text: Pink and red are the colors that could be produced when two pink-flowered (RW) plants are crossed, following a cross in which a red (RR) plant and a white (WW) plant yielded pink (RW) offspring.

H3.text: Pink and white are the colors that could result from crossing two pink flowered plants (RW), following the cross of a red (RR) plant with a white (WW) plant that produced pink (RW) progeny.

A4.text: When plants of the F1 generation are self-pollinated, the phenotypic and genotypic ratio of the F2 generation will be 1:2:1 (Red:Pink:White).

A5.text: The pink snapdragon is the result of incomplete dominance.
